Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Banal \Ban"al\, a. [F., fr. ban an ordinance.] Commonplace; trivial; hackneyed; trite. [1913 Webster]

banal adj 1: obvious and dull; "trivial conversation"; "commonplace prose" [syn: {commonplace}, {trivial}] 2: repeated too often; overfamiliar through overuse; "bromidic sermons"; "his remarks were trite and commonplace"; "hackneyed phrases"; "a stock answer"; "repeating threadbare jokes"; "parroting some timeworn axiom"; "the trite metaphor `hard as nails'" [syn: {commonplace}, {hackneyed}, {old-hat}, {shopworn}, {stock(a)}, {threadbare}, {timeworn}, {tired}, {trite}, {well-worn}]
